contentencoded: Freddie Mac, the government backed mortgage giant, just posted very strong earnings. Freddie pulled in 5 billion dollars last quarter, the second largest profit in its history. John Silvia is chief economist at Wells Fargo, explains why just a few years after coming to the brink of collapse, Freddie and Fannie are doing better than ever.
teaser: The government-backed mortgage lender just posted its second largest profit in history.
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, August 7, 2013

title: Freddie Mac is in the money
